description: Risk-adjusted return analysis of stocks in your watchlist over the past quarter (90 days). This analysis calculates Sharpe ratios to identify which watchlist stocks provide the best returns relative to their volatility, helping you make informed investment decisions by balancing potential gains against risk levels.

body.description: Time period used for calculating quarterly returns and volatility metrics for watchlist stocks
Name of the watchlist being analyzed
Number of stocks from your watchlist that had sufficient trading data for analysis
Current 3-month Treasury rate used as the risk-free baseline for Sharpe ratio calculations
Stock symbol with the highest risk-adjusted return (best Sharpe ratio)
Quarterly return of the top-performing stock by risk-adjusted metrics
Annualized volatility of the top-performing stock
Sharpe ratio of top performer. Values above 2.0 are considered excellent risk-adjusted returns
Stock symbol with the second-highest risk-adjusted return
Quarterly return of the second-best performing stock
Sharpe ratio of second-best performer, indicating very good risk-adjusted returns
Stock symbol with the third-highest risk-adjusted return
Quarterly return of the third-best performing stock
Sharpe ratio of third-best performer, indicating good risk-adjusted returns
Stock symbol with the lowest risk-adjusted return in your watchlist
Quarterly return of the worst-performing stock by risk-adjusted metrics
Negative Sharpe ratio indicating poor risk-adjusted performance
Average quarterly return across all analyzed watchlist stocks
Average Sharpe ratio of your watchlist, indicating overall good risk-adjusted performance
Top recommended stocks from your watchlist based on superior risk-adjusted returns
Watchlist stocks with decent risk-adjusted returns suitable for holding
Watchlist stocks with poor risk-adjusted returns that may need portfolio review
Overall grade for watchlist diversification across sectors and risk levels
